answers.author: Nole Walkingshaw
answers.text:
I am the project administrator for  Salt Lake City's e-plan submissions program. Salt lake City has done this using a hybrid between Accela and Project dox. The advantage here was that we were able to incorpoarate a shared database for all development activities plus and the e-plan review. Accela and Project Dox each work with gis systems and with a good ort writer you are able to leverage massive amounts of geospatial data.
I have attached a power point recently presented at the Microsoft Conference Center.

answers.author: Roderick Wood
answers.text:
Electronic is the way to go.  There are several companies that offer this type of software and that companion very well with other companies to produce a full system of programs.  most of these systems are web based so work fully with any GIS system and much of your other city software such as with finance.  Systems that are all-in-one often have problems, but that is getting better.  What kind of reports do you need to produce, do you want to track staffing assignments, coordinate with public works and engineering, fire inspections and other possible companion operations?  Each of these systems have their strengths and weaknesses.  The best solution is to send out an RFP with your needs, and see what responses you get and evaluate which provide the best blend of programs to meet your needs.  This is a huge investment not in just dollars, but staff time to load up the system, learn to use it and maintain it over time.  I would never sole source.
